title: Inventor and InventHelp Client Develops Cell-Phone Holder (RCO-136)
text:
Pittsburgh-based InventHelp is submitting this idea, the CPC, to companies for their consideration and potential feedback.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 17, 2015
"I normally keep my phone in my purse, which means that whenever I get a call or text, I have to open my purse and search through everything to find my phone," said an inventor from Buffalo, N.Y. "To keep my phone handy and ready for use, I came up with this device."
She developed the CPC to keep a cell phone close at hand so that it is readily accessible for use. This prevents the user from missing calls and texts. It saves time and effort when responding to calls and texts. The unit also stops the phone from being dropped or left behind. This reduces the risk of the phone getting damaged, misplaced or stolen. Additionally, the invention provides added peace of mind.
The original design was submitted to the Rochester office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-RCO-136, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
